pros: Great working environment and team of nurses

pros:
-great people
-amazing orthopedic care
-benefits - Harvard pilgrim health care, Fidelity 403(b)
-official hospital of the Boston Celtics basketball team for over 30 years - they treat the players
-there is training & career growth 
-parking is not super expensive for the city ($22 per week, so $88 per month - free shuttle)
-on site cafeteria at main campus
-no emergency room
cons:
-outdated systems
-understaffed
-low pay 
-lots of change/unknowns due to now being part of the BILH system
-leaders need more training on management & professionalism
-hesitancy of allowing remote work due to culture of healthcare 
-there is a lot of old school mentality and people there, but I think being a part of BILH will hopefully help get them updated

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Brookline, MA
pros: Friendly Schedule, flexible, and solid pay

pros: Overall good care to the patients. Excellent Nurse Manager
cons: ICU staff liked to gossip lots of clicks. You always feel like an outsider.

pros: The hospital itself is nice
cons: The management and coworkers aren’t good

pros: Culture of respect, ownership, service and excellence (ROSE) is real and present in almost every interaction among employees and patients.  High level of collaboration among physicians, nurses and pharmacists. Management appreciates and recognizes accomplishments. Supervisors understand family needs and creates schedules that are both accommodating and fair. Mistakes are motivation for process improvements,  not punishments. Orthopedic surgical hospital setting means you have a good idea of what to expect for workflow each day. Good benefits. Recent merger to become part of the new Beth Israel Leahy Health system looks promising for growth.
cons: Getting up and down the hill if you take public transportation. Parking, except on weekends and holidays: new hires choose between off-site parking with shuttle service, and 2-hour street parking with many spots reserved for Parker Hill residents only. Can get tricky getting up and down the hill in the winter, no matter how you travel.

review_title: An Hospital with a brand name
pros:
It's an hospital with a brand name and reputation as one of the best orthopedic hospital in the country.
Very attractive compensations
Employee success and achievements are well celebrated
Good community culture. most people know themselves by names
High retention rate (in some departments). people starts and retire there.
cons:
Some departments could be very toxic
Supporting departments like, IT are treated as just commodities
Management are not sometime very transparent.
Reluctant or slow to adopting new technology.

pros: people are nice, they are like family. well i guess the cons overweight the pros cause you cannot really tell much if you have only been there for 6 month
cons:
the tasks and daily works can be very redundant
especially when you are a business major, I have no clue of these insurance companies and they won't let you touch it

pros:
Majority of our patients are there for selective surgery 
Preop classes are available to patients before their patients surgery date
Surgeons are awesome!!!
Small hospital so everyone knows each other ( I was once a patient and it was an awesome experience)
cons: Staffing is not always up to par. We need more nurses but the jobs aren't always posted.

job_title: Human Resources Associate in Boston, MA
pros: This hospital is the perfect size, large enough to have a wide amount of diversity, but small enough to see familiar faces when you want to. Everyone was very welcoming and the environment, in general was very supportive for growth.
cons: The hospital had some aspect that seemed dated, such as the design of the hospital.

pros: Best hospital to work for...everyone is super nice and always ready to help. Work load is very less busy and laid back. Not much to do on a daily basis
cons: Since it’s an orthopedic hospital you dont get to see everything there...no emergency department, pediatric or labor and delivery. It’s limiting

cons: Can be monotonous due to the fact that it’s solely an orthopedic hospital
